vision.notes: Inferred to be present as they are found in a range of depths, including the photic zone (Paratrachichthys fernandezianus). Species like Paratrachichthys macleayi inhabit open rocky reefs, suggesting visual reliance.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely important for detecting prey and predators in their deep-sea and reef environments. The network of muciferous canals riddling their heads (as noted in the family description) suggests a well-developed lateral line system.

chemoreception.notes: Inferred to be present for foraging and social interactions, as in most fish families.
